articles.content: The 'real' Mo Farah whose identity was allegedly used to smuggle the Team GB hero into the UK to work as a domestic slave is a 'penniless' Somalian student living in Turkey who dreams of meeting his … [+13523 chars]

articles.title: Bolton Wanderers boss Ian Evatt's heatwave training vow after Carlisle defeat - The Bolton News
articles.description: WANDERERS will be returning for work despite the scorching temperatures in Bolton today, says Ian Evatt.
articles.content:
WANDERERS wont be offered any let-up in the blazing temperatures forecast for Bolton this week.

articles.title: Chris Foy: England's series win over Australia was a triumph, but Eddie Jones' men have work to do - Daily Mail
articles.description: CHRIS FOY: Job done. Series won. Crisis averted. Critics silenced - or at least hushed for a while. And yet...as England flew home with a victory, they will know they still have a long, long way to go.

articles.title: Rory McIlroy suffers yet another near miss in his bid to win a first major since 2014 at The Open - Daily Mail
articles.description: RIATH AL-SAMARRAI: McIlroy was left needing to chip in for eagle at the last to force a play-off, but he suffered the pain of yet another near-miss in his bid to win a first major since 2014.
articles.content:
Rory McIlroy was close to tears after admitting he let The Open 'slip away' in a thrilling final-day at St Andrews that eventually saw Australia's Cameron Smith lift the Claret Jug.
